greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct prime divisors of 77...771 (with n 7's).
comment: Also number of distinct prime factors of (10^(n + 1) - 1)*7/9 - 6. - _Stefan Steinerberger_, Mar 01 2006
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..231
example: The number of distinct prime divisors of 71 is 1 (prime).
The number of distinct prime divisors of 771 is 2.
The number of distinct prime divisors of 7771 is 2.
xref: Cf. A104484 (3 instead of 7), A104659 (4 instead of 7), A104517 (5 instead of 7), A104890 (6 instead of 7), A105972 (8 instead of 7), A105259 (9 instead of 7).
results.author: _Parthasarathy Nambi_, Apr 20 2005
ext: Offset corrected and more terms added by _Amiram Eldar_, Jan 24 2020
